title: Are you interested in music? Why? - Quora

response.answer_text: At the moment, I have a great interest in music. This began at around the age of seven. At that stage, it wasn't so much of an "interest" as it was the knowledge that if I signed up to learn violin, I'd get out of maths once a week to attend lessons. I had little interest in the instrument other than that. At that age, I hated the way music was taught as a subject at school and the only kind of music I was exposed to was what my parents listened to - 80's and 90's pop, 70's punk rock. I remember pretending to enjoy what my parents liked for their validation and appreciation, but I didn't really develop my own taste in music until I was around eleven when I'd begin to hear songs I liked on the radio and listen to them on Youtube, which would recommend similar songs that I liked. Now I'm sixteen, and music is one of the biggest aspects of my life. I must have started listening to classical music when I was about fourteen, and I'm still constantly blown away with different pieces and composers. I switched from playing in a traditional Scottish style to playing primarily in classical, and there's something immensely rewarding in playing even simple pieces; I find it so surreal that I can make such beautiful sounds with an inanimate object. I think it's fascinating that some of the pieces I play and listen to were composed hundreds of years ago by people who probably had no idea that their work would still be taught today. I become more interested in and appreciative of music the more I listen to. I'm currently taking graded exams in violin, guitar, and vocals with the hopes of reaching grade eight in the latter. I also have a significant list of instruments I'd like to learn, like piano and cello. Music helps me to feel better. It calms me down when I'm anxious; I can sit and listen to a classical symphony and try to pick out the instruments and concepts to take my mind off what's worrying me. It helps me connect with my friends; I listen to all of their recommendations and develop a greater understanding of them with each one. It helps me knuckle down and study without distractions. It helps me make friends with a wider community of classical musicians who share my passions. I hope to retain my interest in music throughout adulthood. I'd like to take it as a degree at some point, and maybe become a music teacher or music therapist. I'd like to instill an interest in music in others so that it can benefit them as it did me.

Yes, I'm interested in music I'm interested in music because music is life! Music heals my body and spirit, when I'm down and out the only friend I lean on is music I listen to music that will cheer me up, give me hope and remind me of who I am. As a writer I'm also a composer I tell my story through music, when I sing and write is all about me in the song. When I need the world to hear me… I tell my story through singing! Music is a gifted bag full of fun, inspiration and motivation looking for a determined heart to pass it on. I would like to go places through singing and composing of songs for me and other music lovers worldwide! So I'm very much interested in music! Stay blessed and smile!

I have always been interested in music - I love it as a form of self expression and even catharsis. I’ve had a mild interest in music even when I was a young child, but I was too insecure to pursue a career in professional musicianship, even though many of my relatives are professional musicians or teachers. I started playing guitar as a teenager due to my love of heavy metal music. It was great relief and a way to bond with my brother. We played in a band for a while, had some fun. Nowadays I play less, but I still enjoy the various ways that people find to express their emotions through music. Technology has added a great variety of options in the way that people can compose, perform and what kind of tones they can reach. It’s all pretty fascinating.

Music is a part of my life. It's being very long time since my child hood , when my elder sister listening to music , I'm also always there to listen and feel the happiness and goodness of music. It's not just enjoyment element but it helps you at every stage of your life (happy , sad , enjoy , excitement , remember ). Music helps me to keep my dearest to close to my heart.

Music is an asonishingly beautiful creation that can control how you feel depending on the tones, instruments, rhythm, etc… Music has always held a special spot in my heart — it’s been my best friend my entire life. It’s always there for you, it’s the greatest comforter. But it can also hurt you. Bring back memories from a time you don’t want to remember, making you feel every sense from the memory. It can bring pain, but it can bring beauty. When I play or listen to music, my soul feels alive. It’s like a fairytale.

I play classical piano by memory only. Despite cutting 3/4 of a hand off and being a vegetable after a coma. I can’t count the blessings. Can’t read music and never had a lesson, but play Bach, Beethoven, Mozart, Chopin and Debussy pieces by memory.  Can’t read TwinkleTwinkle Little Star without going Every Good Boy Does Fine….
It's like poetry it speaks to me and changes my moods and emotions
